content: single_crochet instead of final ch5 body of bag *ch5 single_crochet in next ch5 space* repeat around end with ch2 double_crochet in top of double_crochet of previous round repeat this round 22 times top of bag round 1 ch1 half_double_crochet around the double_crochet as though it were a ch3 3hdc in each loop around 2hdc in last loop slip_stitch to first half_double_crochet 99 half_double_crochet around round 2 ch1 single_crochet in same place as ch1 single_crochet in each half_double_crochet around slip_stitch in first single_crochet repeat round 2 once more handles ch1 single_crochet in same place as ch1 single_crochet in next 3 single_crochet ch1 turn 4 single_crochet repeat this row until handle is ~16 long ch1 cut yarn leaving long tail for sewing pull tail through to fasten_off along top of bag count 16 single_crochet beyond handle sew other end of handle to next 4 single_crochet for next handle count 25 single_crochet along top of bag from 1st handle make a sliding loop on hook & join yarn in 26th single_crochet single_crochet in same single_crochet & in next 3 single_crochet ch1 turn 4 single_crochet make handle to match the first sew end of handle as the first one enjoy your string bag abbreviations chain- chain single_crochet- single_crochet double_crochet- double_crochet half_double_crochet- half-double crochet slip_stitch-slip_stitch copyright 2011 lisa gwinner
